medical_history.chief_complaint: Upper abdominal pain progressing to diffuse abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to presentation, characterized by diffuse abdominal pain, x4 bouts of non-bilious/non-bloody emesis, diarrhea, and a self-reported temperature of 100.7. The patient continues to experience abdominal pain and nausea, with a prior episode of diaphoresis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, history of diverticulitis (last episode ___ years ago), coronary angiogram and ECHO showing no significant CAD and EF of 51%.
medical_history.family_history: CAD/PVD - Mother with MI at ___, CAD/PVD - Father, deceased from aneurysm at age ___.
